item.title: 美联储料将维持利率不变，降息暂停期开启
item.description: 美联储预计将于周三维持利率不变，投资者认为此次暂停加息的状态将持续至美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔3月和4月的最后两次会议之后。其继任者预计将在夏季前就职，而政策制定者们对是否需要进一步降低借贷成本存在分歧。【原文：The Federal Reserve is expected to hold interest rates steady on Wednesday in a pause that ​investors see lasting beyond U.S. central bank chief Jerome Powell's final meetings in March and April, with his successor expected to ‌take office by the summer and policymakers split over whether more reductions in borrowing costs are warranted.】

item.title: 对美联储而言，银行贷款的回升可能强化其反对降息的立场。
item.description: 通胀率仍居高不下，劳动力市场虽趋疲软但未崩溃，这正是美联储普遍预计将在周三结束为期两天的会议后维持美国政策利率不变的主要原因。【原文：Still-elevated inflation and a labor market that has ​weakened but not collapsed are the main reasons the Federal Reserve is widely expected to wrap ‌up its two-day meeting Wednesday with a hold on the U.S. policy rate.】

item.title: Stellantis法国公司将于2026年加大折扣力度以重振销量水平
item.description: Stellantis集团法国负责人泽维尔·杜谢曼周三表示，该集团今年将在法国加大新车降价力度，以提振其在欧洲最大市场的销量。【原文：Stellantis will step up price cuts on new cars sold in France this year in a push to rebuild sales volumes, the group's largest European market, Stellantis France chief Xavier Duchemin said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美元期权交易员转为看跌，"再见美国"抛售潮加剧
item.description: 本周期权交易者对美元的看跌情绪显著升温。此前美国总统特朗普对美元本月2.5%的跌幅不以为意，导致周三买入其他货币的衍生品成本升至数月高位。【原文：Options traders have turned overwhelmingly negative towards the dollar this week, after President Donald Trump brushed off the U.S. currency's 2.5% slide this month, pushing the cost of derivatives to buy other currencies to the highest in months on Wednesday.】

item.title: 亚马逊全球裁员1.6万人，在人工智能推动下撤销疫情期间招聘计划
item.description: 亚马逊宣布三个月内第二轮大规模裁员，此举旨在疫情期间过度招聘后的重组，同时扩大人工智能工具的应用范围。【原文：Amazon announced the second major round of layoffs in ​three months, as it restructures after pandemic-era over-hiring and expands the adoption of ‌artificial intelligence tools.】

item.title: 英国监管机构提议调整谷歌搜索规则以惠及出版商
item.description: 英国竞争监管机构周三提出了一套措施，称这将改善谷歌在该国的搜索服务，包括确保出版商在内容被用于该搜索引擎的人工智能摘要时获得更公平的待遇。【原文：Britain's competition regulator on Wednesday proposed a package of measures that it said would improve Google search services in the country, including making sure publishers get a fairer deal over how their content is used in the engine's AI overviews.】

item.title: iPhone强劲销量将推动苹果假日季度业绩，谷歌人工智能交易备受关注
item.description: 苹果公司将于周四公布四年来的最强劲iPhone销量增长，这主要得益于其高端Pro机型的强劲需求，同时该公司正准备推出采用谷歌技术开发的人工智能功能。【原文：Apple is set to report its strongest iPhone sales growth in four years on Thursday, driven by robust demand for its premium Pro models as it prepares to roll out artificial intelligence features developed with Google's technology.】

item.title: 意大利网络司令部内部：严阵以待应对冬奥会的人工智能威胁
item.description: 在罗马一座现代政府大楼内，数十名专家正紧盯着三世纪奥勒良城墙。过去一年间，他们持续监控暗网上的犯罪活动，这是意大利为保护冬季奥运会免受网络攻击而采取的行动之一。【原文：Inside a modern government building facing the third‑century Aurelian walls in Rome, dozens of specialists have spent the past year monitoring criminal chatter on the dark web as part of Italy's push to shield the Winter Olympics from cyberattacks.】

item.title: 日本央行前官员称，日本目前可能暂缓干预日元汇率
item.description: 日本央行前官员竹内厚志告诉路透社，日本目前可能暂缓官方干预，因为与美国协调的策略已帮助阻止日元单边下跌。十年前，竹内曾参与东京央行的市场干预行动。【原文：Japan may hold off on official intervention for now, with coordinated tactics involving the U.S. already helping to halt a one-sided slide in the yen, Atsushi Takeuchi, a former central bank official who took part in Tokyo's market forays a decade ago, told Reuters.】

item.title: 香港科学家推出人工智能模型以更准确预测极端天气
item.description: 香港科学家团队研发出一种人工智能天气预报系统，可提前四小时预测雷暴和暴雨，而当前预报范围仅为20分钟至两小时。【原文：A team of Hong Kong scientists has developed an artificial intelligence weather-forecasting system to predict thunderstorms and heavy downpours up to four hours ahead, compared with the range of 20 minutes to two hours now.】

item.title: 印度金融科技公司Pine Labs季度盈利，得益于强劲的数字支付需求
item.description: 印度金融科技公司Pine Labs周三公布连续第三个季度盈利，得益于强劲需求推动，越来越多的用户转向数字支付。【原文：Indian fintech firm Pine Labs reported a third straight quarterly profit on Wednesday, supported by strong demand as more users shift to digital payments.】

item.title: 日经报道：艾利奥特考虑对丰田工业发起要约收购
item.description: 日本《日经新闻》周三报道称，激进投资者埃利奥特投资管理公司正考虑对丰田工业发起要约收购，这可能使丰田集团将这家叉车制造商私有化的努力进一步复杂化。【原文：Activist investor Elliott Investment Management is considering a tender offer for Toyota Industries , the Nikkei business daily reported on Wednesday, in what could further complicate an effort by the Toyota group to take the forklift maker private.】

item.title: 二线城市涌现高端商品，奢侈品在中国本土化浪潮中扎根
item.description: 中国所谓的二线城市正迅速成为奢侈品商的首选之地，中产阶级消费者在低成本地区追求高品质生活，同时带着他们对昂贵汽车和奢华配饰的偏好。【原文：China's so-called second-tier cities are fast becoming the first stop for luxury goods vendors as middle-class consumers seek high living standards in lower-cost locales, taking with them their penchant for pricey parkers and expensive extras.】

item.title: 阿尔巴内塞称澳大利亚决心重新掌控达尔文港所有权
item.description: 澳大利亚总理安东尼·阿尔巴内塞周三表示，澳大利亚承诺将一个租期99年的关键北部港口从中国公司手中收回，归还澳大利亚所有权。此前，中国驻堪培拉大使警告将采取贸易报复措施。【原文：Australia was committed to returning a key northern port leased for 99 years to a Chinese company to Australian ownership, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Wednesday after Beijing's envoy to Canberra warned of trade reprisals.】

item.title: 解读：印度为何可能提高黄金白银进口关税
item.description: 印度去年黄金和白银进口量飙升至历史最高水平，引发政策制定者的担忧。尽管贵金属价格居高不下，但进口量依然坚挺，而政府几乎没有有效手段来遏制这种流入。【原文：India's gold and silver imports surged to record levels last year, sparking concern among policymakers, with the government having few effective tools to curb inflows that have remained resilient despite sky-high prices for the precious metals.】

item.title: LVMH股价下跌，因业绩表现令人失望
item.description: 路易威登集团（LVMH）周三公布第四季度财报后股价下跌6%，市场对这家奢侈品集团利润率下滑以及对需求复苏初期迹象持谨慎态度感到失望。【原文：LVMH shares fell 6% on Wednesday after its fourth-quarter results, with the market disappointed at the luxury group's weaker margin and cautious tone on the first signs of demand recovery.】

item.title: SK海力士季度利润创纪录，受益于巨大的人工智能需求，远超预期
item.description: 韩国SK海力士周三表示，季度利润翻倍至创纪录水平，轻松超越市场预期。人工智能领域持续强劲的需求推高了先进和传统存储芯片的价格。【原文：South Korea's SK Hynix said on Wednesday that quarterly profit more than doubled to a record, comfortably beating forecasts on relentless demand for artificial intelligence that has lifted prices for both advanced and conventional memory chips.】

item.title: 波音预计未来20年印度及南亚地区将新增3,290架喷气式飞机
item.description: 波音公司周三表示，预计未来20年印度及南亚航空公司将新增3290架商用飞机。经济增长势头强劲、中产阶级规模扩大以及大量首次乘机旅客涌入，共同推动了航空旅行需求。【原文：Boeing on Wednesday said it expects airlines in India and South Asia to add 3,290 commercial jets to their fleets over the next 20 years, as resilient economic growth, a growing middle class and a wave of first-time flyers drive demand for air travel.】

item.title: 欧元升值至1.20美元为何意义重大
item.description: 欧元兑美元汇率刚刚创下新纪录，凸显出随着市场对美元情绪恶化，单一货币正重启升值步伐。【原文：The euro has just hit a new milestone against the dollar, highlighting the single currency's renewed ​push higher as sentiment towards the greenback sours.】

item.title: 独家：欧盟与越南拟加强矿产、芯片及"可信"5G领域合作，草案文件显示
item.description: 据路透社获得的一份联合声明草案显示，欧盟与越南希望在关键矿产、半导体和基础设施领域提升贸易与投资。该声明将于周四随着双方提升外交关系而正式通过。【原文：The European Union and Vietnam want to boost trade and investment in critical minerals, semiconductors and infrastructure, according to a draft joint statement seen by Reuters that is set to be adopted on Thursday as the two sides upgrade diplomatic relations.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯拒绝卢特尼克迁往美国的提议，首席执行官向先锋报透露
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德·卢特尼克一年前曾试图说服梅赛德斯-奔驰首席执行官奥拉·卡伦纽斯将这家德国汽车制造商的总部迁至美国，但这位首席执行官拒绝了这一提议，他向德国新闻网站《先锋报》透露。【原文：U.S. Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick tried to persuade Mercedes-Benz boss Ola Kaellenius a year ago to move the German carmaker's headquarters to the United States, but the CEO turned down the offer, he told German news site The Pioneer.】

item.title: 韩国汽车制造商起亚表示，铂金价格上涨正对其成本产生影响。
item.description: 韩国汽车制造商起亚公司周三表示，铂、钯和铑等原材料价格上涨对其成本产生重大影响。【原文：South Korean automaker Kia Corp said on Wednesday that price increases of raw materials such as platinum, palladium and rhodium are having a major impact on its costs.】

item.title: 卡车制造商沃尔沃集团第四季度利润超预期，股息增长滞后
item.description: 瑞典卡车制造商沃尔沃集团周三公布的数据显示，其第四季度营业利润下滑幅度小于预期，但全年股息总额削减幅度超出市场预期。【原文：Swedish truckmaker Volvo Group reported a smaller-than-forecast decline in fourth-quarter operating profit on Wednesday, but cut its overall annual dividend payment by more than expected.】

item.title: ASML第四季度订单超预期，芯片制造商加紧采购以满足人工智能需求
item.description: 全球最大计算机芯片设备供应商ASML周三公布的订单量超出预期，得益于人工智能芯片制造产能的扩大投资，该公司获得了更多订单。【原文：ASML reported stronger-than-expected bookings on Wednesday as the world's largest supplier of computer chip equipment received more orders thanks to larger investments in artificial-intelligence chipmaking capacity.】

item.title: 大众汽车首席执行官布鲁姆卸任保时捷职务后，面临扭亏为盈的压力
item.description: 投资者表示，大众汽车首席执行官奥利弗·布鲁姆今年面临关键考验：证明他能够遏制中国市场的下滑趋势，并缩小与竞争对手的技术差距——这些被视为这家德国汽车制造商成功转型的关键要素。【原文：Volkswagen CEO Oliver Blume faces a defining test this year, investors say: to prove he can stem a slide in China and close a tech gap to rivals, regarded as the essential elements for a successful turnaround of the German automaker.】

item.title: 早盘竞价：特朗普言论打压美元
item.description: 汤姆·韦斯特布鲁克带您展望欧洲及全球市场今日走势【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Tom Westbrook】

item.title: 据《金融时报》报道，SpaceX正考虑于2026年6月以1.5万亿美元估值进行首次公开募股。
item.description: 据《金融时报》援引知情人士报道，埃隆·马斯克的SpaceX公司正考虑于2026年6月中旬进行首次公开募股，计划以约1.5万亿美元的估值筹集高达500亿美元资金。【原文：Elon Musk's SpaceX ​is weighing ‌a mid-June 2026 initial public ‌offering, aiming to ​raise as much ‍as $50 billion at a valuation ⁠of ‍roughly $1.5 trillion, the Financial ‌Times ‌reported, citing people familiar ⁠with ⁠the ​matter.】

item.title: 彪马的漫长滑坡：德国运动品牌巨头的兴衰史
item.description: 德国彪马（Puma）及其劲敌阿迪达斯（Adidas）的根源可追溯至同一栋房屋——一个世纪前，鲁道夫·达斯勒（Rudolf Dassler）与阿道夫·达斯勒（Adolf Dassler）兄弟在此创立制鞋事业，直至兄弟反目导致公司一分为二。【原文：Germany's Puma and fierce rival Adidas have their roots in the very same house where brothers Rudolf and Adolf Dassler launched their shoe business a century ago, before a major fall-out between the siblings split the company in two.】

item.title: 解读：英伟达芯片背后的2.5亿美元ASML"打印机"
item.description: ASML凭借其在光刻系统制造领域的统治地位，已成为欧洲市值最高的企业。这些巨大的"芯片打印机"每台造价2.5亿美元，对推动人工智能热潮的企业而言不可或缺。【原文：ASML has become Europe's most valuable company thanks to its dominance in making lithography systems, huge "chip printing" machines that cost $250 million each and are indispensable to firms driving the AI boom.】

item.title: A year into Trump presidency, 'pivot to China' gathers pace
item.description: 一年前，美国总统唐纳德·特朗普以"美国优先"议程上任时，许多人预见中国疲软的经济将面临困境。但北京方面通过改善与其他贸易伙伴的紧张关系，实现了创纪录的贸易顺差。【原文：When U.S. President Donald Trump took office a year ago with an "America First" agenda, many saw trouble for China's sluggish economy, but Beijing has thawed frosty relationships with other trade partners to post a record trade surplus.】
